The chest and back panels are externally lined with Thermal Smoothie neoprene which retains heat and blocks windchill. StretchFlight 3 Tape covers the internal seams for a watertight seal, while triple glued and blind stitched seams offer flexibility from head to toe. Zip up the back using the durable YKK plastic zipper.

name: Women's Swell Series 3/2 Back Zip Wetsuit
description:
Part of Roxy's Swell Series, this long sleeve wetsuit offers maximum protection and warmth in cold weather temperatures with its recycled StretchFlight construction and WarmFlight thermal lining. Complete with a back zip entry system for easy on and off.

PRODUCT DETAILS

Thermal Lining: Eco sleek WarmFlight® at bust (front, sides, back) and wrist
Entry System / Zipper: Back Zip
Hood: No Hood

PRODUCT FEATURES

Water based glue used for lamination
Recycled polyester and nylon used for linings
Back zip entry system with YKK™#10 plastic zip
Supratex knee pads, durable, lightweight & flexible
GlideSkin neck seal
Key loop on outer left leg
Print placement may differ slightly
ADDITIONAL INFO

Stretch Technology
Flexibility for range of motion - so you can move with freedom. Stretch 2 is Roxy's extra stretch. Designed for freedom and range of movement.




Eco Stretch-Flight Neoprene
All wetsuits are made of neoprene. But truly great wetsuits are made of the best neoprene. The higher the quality, the lighter, warmer and more flexible your wetsuit will be. Echo Stretch-Flight is made using eco-friendly limestone for increased warmth and comfort without sacrificing flexibility.




GBS Seams
Seams are the core structure of a wetsuit: they determine the strength, flexibility and water tightness of its construction. Triple glued and single-blind stitched seams are darned to partially penetrate the neoprene to reduce water entry.




Warmth Technology - Lining
Roxy's internal lining adds warmth without impacting your range of movement. Eco Sleek WarmFlight is a silky-smooth, lightweight lining with high quality warmth. Roxy's revolutionary lining technology keeps you warm in unmatched comfort. The lightweight material insulates and repels water for added warmth, flexibility and a faster drying time. 50% of the lining is made using fibers from recycled matter and 50% of the materials are dope-dyed meaning less water, less energy & fewer chemicals are used.




Design Technology
Locking systems, seals and other thoughtfully considered design elements that make life in the water easy. A glide neck seal is an ultra-smooth neoprene liner for comfort and a watertight seal. The Supratex knee pad is a durable, lightweight and flexible outer knee pad that protects you and your board.




Entry System
Convenience, performance or a mix of both. No matter what your taste, we’ve got you covered. The back zip is a free floating zipper technology that will keep you dry. Easy to get into and effortless to get out of.




Sustainability
Roxy considers the use of recycled and naturally sourced materials, water input, energy usage and eco-toxicity in each design choice. Roxy's internal and external linings are made using recycled poly and nylon to keep plastic out of the ocean and reduce consumption.

Warmth and Performance of Graphene
Infused with 100% recycled fibers lining the entire interior of the suit
Superlight foam is lightweight, eco-friendly and provides great thermal retention.
The ideal blend of flexibility and thermal retention
Aqua Alpha non-toxic, water-based glue
Superflex tape with water based adhesive
ADDITIONAL INFO

MANUFACTURER'S DESCRIPTION

The Synergy Series wetsuits deliver lightweight, premium heat and innovative technology with superior value and durability. Made from stretchy and eco-conscious Superlight neoprene combined with glued and blind stitched sealed external seams, the women’s wetsuit boasts excellent thermal retention. Graphene recycler lining at the front and back panels adds incredible strength and heat without adding bulk, while silicone stretch panels at the arms and legs let you get in and out with ease. Finished with a back zip entry, the 3/2 Synergy Full Wetsuit is offered in a variety of colors and delivers everything you demand from a premium wetsuit, without breaking the bank.

name: Women's Hyperfreak Fire 3/2+ Chest Zip Wetsuit
description:
With the latest technology, the Women's Hyperfreak Fire 3/2 does not disappoint. The Hyperfreak has been one of O’Neill’s best-selling wetsuits for years and is now offered in the Fire addition. This could be arguably the best wetsuit ever created with the new lining. The extreme warmth, high performance, and increased durability of the Hyperfreak Fire come from O’Neill’s Technobutter 4 neoprene and watertight fluid seams. Look no further if you’re in the market for the best-performing wetsuit with sustainable properties.

PRODUCT DETAILS
Thickness: 3/2mm+
Front / Back / Thigh / Butt: TB4 Firewall
Shoulder / Shin / Calf: TechnoButter 4
Entry / Sleeves: TechnoButter 4X
Entry System / Zipper: Chest Zip
Hood: No Hood
Model Year: 2022/2023
MPN: 5519
PRODUCT FEATURES
F.U.Z.E. Closure (Chest Zip)
360 degree Barrier With Drainholes and Anti-Flush Barrier (F.U.Z.E.)
Tapered Cuffs with Segmented 3D Wrist and Ankle Seals
Recycled Oyster Shells and Eco Carbon Black Infused Neoprene
Redzone Water Resistant Zipper
Recycled Dope-Dyed Yarn Jersey
Aqua Alpha Solvent Free Neoprene Lamination
Key Pocket with Loop
Triple Glued and Blindstitched with Exterior Fluid Seam Weld Technology
PLUS (+) = 0.5mm Extra thickness for even more warmth
ADDITIONAL INFO

O'Neill uses recycled ocean oyster shells in place of calcium carbonate powder which comprises approximately 10% of their neoprene. O’Neill worked with their key manufacturing partner to develop a non-solvent based lamination glue called “aqua-alpha”. Aqua alpha reduces solvent usage by 600 grams per wetsuit compared to traditional laminating glues. Eliminates harmful VOCs and has the same durability as conventional, solvent-based Wetsuit glues. From recycled polybags to 100% recycled paper and soy based inks hang tags. Conserving water, energy and virgin materials. 100% digital catalogs. Dope-dying infusion produces colored yarns without the dyeing process. This saves tremendous amounts of water while reducing energy consumption and water pollution (up to 80%). 26% carbon emission is reduced for every kg of fabric. Every blueprint full suit saves more than 1 lb/0.5 kg of harmful plastic from potentially polluting the world’s living oceans. Carbon black is one of the key ingredients in neoprene. It can now be carbonized from scrap rubber tires using high heat to extract. 72% carbon emission declined. O’Neill’s advanced repair facility prolongs the life cycle of their product, keeping their wetsuit out of the landfill longer.



PRODUCT CONSTRUCTION

TB4 AIR FIREWALL
The next great thermal breakthrough was made better with trapped pockets of air. TB4 Air Firewall uses a special lamination process paired with a core of aerated neoprene and a graphene fiber jersey to create the toastiest conditions. Take summer with you.

TB4 FIREWALL
The all new Technobutter 4 Firewall utilizes the recycled graphene fibers at a thicker pile to create a fire hot feedback loop. As the body heat warms the graphene fibers they conduct the heat back into the body.

TECHNOBUTTER 4X
Technobutter 4x goes beyond the gooey stretch, and soft feel of TB3x. Recycled graphene fibers line the jersey allowing for incredible stretch with added strength and warmth retention, all with a new look.

TECHNOBUTTER 4
TB4 builds on the legendary Technobutter 3, the next evolution of the jersey introduces recycled yarns infused with graphene for increased wear strength and heat retention.

MANUFACTURER’S DESCRIPTION

The O'Neill Hyperfreak Fire range focuses on extreme warmth, high performance, increased durability, and comfort. All-new sustainable, buttery soft, heat recirculating TechnoButter 4 materials line each suit. These technologically advanced materials plus water-tight Fluid Seam construction have created a new cold water legend. Fire red-hot heat takes the innovative Hyperfreak legacy to the next level.

name: Women's R2 Yulex 3.5/3 Chest Zip Wetsuit
description:
Patagonia’s completely redesigned their women’s wetsuits, which now feature a breezy asymmetrical entrance (they slide on and off with ease), a new fit and an ultra-soft 100% recycled polyester internal lining that feels like a second skin. The Women’s 3.5m/3mm R2® Yulex® Front-Zip is for water in the 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit range. This is for the surfer who wants to get in the water faster, surf longer and wear a suit that leaves a lighter impact on the environment than ever before.

Patagonia’s wetsuit line has been completely redesigned this season. The new suits feature an updated patterning across the back shoulder seam for ease of motion while paddling; a wider, lower-profile internal seam tape for utmost comfort; new 100% recycled, ultra-soft polyester arm and leg linings that saves 18 water bottles per suit; 100% recycled spandex in the external and internal thermal linings; AQUAa water-based glue; and, solution-dyed linings. They’re still constructed from a neoprene-free blend of 85% Yulex® natural rubber from sources that are FSC® certified by the Rainforest Alliance (meaning the forest of hevea trees––the source of the rubber––doesn’t come from a newly cut rainforest) and 15% synthetic rubber by polymer content. All Patagonia’s wetsuits are Fair Trade Certified™ sewn (the only Fair Trade Certified™ wetsuits in the industry, by the way).

Seams: Sealed/Taped

Hood: None

Manufacturers Part Number: 88519
PRODUCT FEATURES
Made with neoprene-free 85% Yulex natural rubber/15% synthetic rubber (by polymer content) that meets rigorous standards for performance, durability, warmth and sustainability; the natural rubber is derived from sources that are Forest Stewardship Council certified by the Rainforest Alliance; the synthetic rubber is chlorine-free

name: Women's Omega 3/2 Back Zip Wetsuit
description:
Less is more with the Rip Curl Women’s Omega 3/2 Back Zip Wetsuit. With high-end features like an E5/E3 neoprene blend and E5 stress point tape, the Omega has every you need to tackle your favorite surf spot. Suit up quickly with the generous back zip entry, complete with a Batwing barrier between your body and the zipper material. When the wind picks up, the smooth skin paneling located on the front torso acts as a wind barrier while also absorbing the sun’s rays for warmth.

PRODUCT DETAILS
Thickness: 3/2mm
Neoprene: E5/E3
Zipper: Back Zip
Hood: No Hood
Model Year: 2021/2022
Manufacturers Part Number: WSM9LW
PRODUCT FEATURES
Easy back zip entry system
Adjustable collar
Designed with a water resistant steel head zipper with offset teeth and urethane coating
Batwing System prevents leakage and flushing between the body and back zipper
Smooth mesh skin panels in the chest and that absorbs the suns solar rays for increased warmth
Highly waterproof triple glued and blindstitched seams that are stretchy and comfortable
ADDITIONAL INFO

Premium E5 neoprene is lightweight and provides 10% more warmth than E4 with 30% more stretch and is 20% lighter: used in the arms. Premium E3 neoprene is standard high stretch and lightweight with high durability properties: used in the core and legs. Increased durability with E5 stress point taping at critical neoprene junctions. The Omega incorporates some high–end features including E5 Neoprene and E3 Neoprene at an economical price.

MANUFACTURER’S DESCRIPTION

The Women's 3/2 Omega Wetsuit is a perfect introductory suit at an affordable price. Rip Curl incorporates high-end features such as; E5 and E3 neoprene, mesh skin panels, a hydro-loc collar, and E5 stress point tape to ensure comfort, warmth, and stretch. The back zip entry system makes it easy to get in and out of this suit, and with the added Batwing there is a barrier between your body and the zipper to keep you comfortable and prevent leakage and flushing. The triple glued and double stitched seams don't fully penetrate the neoprene, allowing for a waterproof seam with high stretch. Here’s the suit for the often-temperate Southern California (or somewhere like it) late-autumn into winter. The R1® Yulex® Front-Zip is a 3mm/2.5mm suit, built to perform and keep you warm in water temps at 60-65 degrees Fahrenheit. And, like all of Patagonia’s suits, it’s designed to last you multiple seasons and daily sessions (if that’s the kind of surfer you are).

Patagonia’s new suits feature an updated patterning across the back shoulder seam for ease of motion while paddling; a wider, lower-profile internal seam tape for utmost comfort; new 100% recycled, ultra-soft polyester arm and leg linings that saves 18 water bottles per suit; 100% recycled spandex in the external and internal thermal linings; AQUAa water-based glue; and, solution-dyed linings. They’re still constructed from a neoprene-free blend of 85% Yulex® natural rubber from sources that are FSC® certified by the Rainforest Alliance (meaning the forest of hevea trees––the source of the rubber––doesn’t come from a newly cut rainforest) and 15% synthetic rubber by polymer content. All Patagonia’s wetsuits are Fair Trade Certified™ sewn (the only Fair Trade Certified™ wetsuits in the industry, by the way).

description:

O’Neill did a great job at creating an eco-friendly and high-performing wetsuit. The TB4 Air Firewall technology improves durability and warmth. PRODUCT FEATURES
F.U.Z.E. Closure (Chest Zip)
Redzone Water Resistant Zipper
360 degree Barrier With Drainholes and Anti-Flush Barrier (F.U.Z.E.)

Recycled Dope-Dyed Yarn Jersey
Aqua Alpha Solvent Free Neoprene Lamination
Key Pocket with Loop
Recycled TBX Fully Taped Glued and Blindstitched Seams
PLUS (+) = 0.5mm Extra thickness for even more warmth
ADDITIONAL INFO

O'Neill uses recycled ocean oyster shells in place of calcium carbonate powder which comprises approximately 10% of their neoprene. O’Neill worked with their key manufacturing partner to develop a non-solvent based lamination glue called “aqua-alpha”. Aqua alpha reduces solvent usage by 600 grams per wetsuit compared to traditional laminating glues. Eliminates harmful VOCs and has the same durability as conventional, solvent-based Wetsuit glues. From recycled polybags to 100% recycled paper and soy based inks hang tags. Conserving water, energy and virgin materials. 100% digital catalogs. Dope-dying infusion produces colored yarns without the dyeing process. This saves tremendous amounts of water while reducing energy consumption and water pollution (up to 80%). 26% carbon emission is reduced for every kg of fabric. Every blueprint full suit saves more than 1 lb/0.5 kg of harmful plastic from potentially polluting the world’s living oceans. Carbon black is one of the key ingredients in neoprene. It can now be carbonized from scrap rubber tires using high heat to extract. 72% carbon emission declined. These products are made of Bluesign® approved fabrics and produced in a resource conserving way with a minimum impact on people and the environment. O’Neill’s advanced repair facility prolongs the life cycle of their product, keeping their wetsuit out of the landfill longer.



PRODUCT CONSTRUCTION

TB4 AIR FIREWALL
The next great thermal breakthrough was made better with trapped pockets of air. TB4 Air Firewall uses a special lamination process paired with a core of aerated neoprene and a graphene fiber jersey to create the toastiest conditions. Take summer with you.

TB4 FIREWALL
The all new Technobutter 4 Firewall utilizes the recycled graphene fibers at a thicker pile to create a fire hot feedback loop. As the body heat warms the graphene fibers they conduct the heat back into the body.

TECHNOBUTTER 4X
Technobutter 4x goes beyond the gooey stretch, and soft feel of TB3x. Recycled graphene fibers line the jersey allowing for incredible stretch with added strength and warmth retention, all with a new look.

TECHNOBUTTER 4
TB4 builds on the legendary Technobutter 3, the next evolution of the jersey introduces recycled yarns infused with graphene for increased wear strength and heat retention.

F.U.Z.E. ZIP CLOSURE
Front Upper Zip Entry (chest) uses a free floating zipper panel and anti flush barrier with drain holes to keep you dry and feeling loose.

RECYCLED TBX FULLY TAPED / GBS SEAMS
The lightest, stretchiest neoprene seam tape ever. 0.5mm split-neoprene applied to triple-glued seams with water-based glue to keep you dry and loose. Blind stitched and triple glued to create a watertight seam, for increased durability while allowing the maximum stretch possible in a sealed seam.

MANUFACTURER’S DESCRIPTION

The O'Neill Blueprint range offers mind-boggling minimal seams, flexibility, and warmth. The legacy of innovation continues with the latest exclusive eco-friendly TB4 materials and their most minimalistic panel design yet. The Blueprint uses the ultra-warm and stretchy TechnoButter 4 Firewall to introduce full coverage, including arms, body, and low legs. This is O'Neill's warmest, highest performing sustainable wetsuit to date.

name: Women's R1 Yulex 3/2.5 Back Zip Wetsuit
description:
A stretchy, neoprene-free wetsuit made of 85% Yulex natural rubber/15% synthetic rubber by polymer content; the natural rubber is derived from sources that are Forest Stewardship Council certified by the Rainforest Alliance. Made in a Fair Trade Certified facility. Suggested water temperatures: 60–65° F/16–18° C.

The Patagonia Women's R1 Yulex 3/2.5 Back Zip Wetsuit is now made in a Fair Trade Certified facility. These neoprene-free Yulex wetsuits are made of 85% natural rubber/15% synthetic rubber by polymer content. Replacing a petroleum-based material with a plant-based one, they offer the same warmth and performance attributes as conventional stretch neoprene while reducing CO2 emissions by up to ~80% in the manufacturing process. Derived from sources that are Forest Stewardship Council certified by the Rainforest Alliance, natural rubber has been blended with chlorine-free synthetic rubber to increase ozone- and UV-resistance, and meets rigorous standards for strength, stretch and durability. With new patterning for maximum flexibility and improved fit, the R1 Yulex Back-Zip Full Suit is 3mm in the torso and thighs, lined with high-stretch, fast-drying 95% polyester (51% recycled)/5% spandex inverted microgrid; 2.5mm in the arms and legs, lined with high-stretch, fast-drying 100% recycled polyester jersey; the face fabric is 85% recycled polyester/15% spandex. The face fabric and lining are now solution dyed—using 86% less water than conventional dyeing—and are laminated with water-based AquaA glue that’s free from harmful volatile organic compounds (VOCs). The suit’s center-back zip allows easy access and has an internal gasket to prevent water entry. Supratex kneepads and ankle cuffs provide excellent abrasion resistance and increased durability. 100% external seam sealing; all seams are triple glued and internally taped. Easy-access key loop included. Suggested water temperatures: 60–65° F/16–18° C.
